Estimater 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Logistic Regression Pipeline

    logistic_regression_pipeline.Rd

    Calculates optimized coefficients, the confidence interval, and performance metrics for the logistic regression model. Then it returns all of these values in a list

    logistic_regression_pipeline(n, lambda, beta_true, B = 20, alpha = 0.05)

    Arguments

    n

    An integer specifying the number of observations

    lambda

    The rate parameter for the Poisson distribution

    beta_true

    A vector of true coefficients

    B

    The number of bootstraps. Default is 20

    alpha

    The significance level to obtain for the 1 - alpha confidence intervals for Beta. Default is .05

    Value

    A list of key logistic regression model findings

    beta_hat

    The optimized coefficients

    confidence_interval

    The confidence interval

    metrics

    The key performance metrics for the logistic regression model as a list

    Author

    Destanie Pitt, Hayden Billmann, Ashton Wise

    Examples

    # Example usage:
# Set parameters for logistic regression pipeline
n <- 100
lambda <- 3
beta_true <- c(0.5, -1, 2)
B <- 50
alpha <- 0.05
results <- logistic_regression_pipeline(n, lambda, beta_true, B, alpha)
#> Beta Estimates:
#>            [,1]
#> [1,]  0.1203733
#> [2,] -1.4196705
#> [3,]  4.2684526
#> 
#> Confidence Intervals:
#>            [,1]        [,2]      [,3]
#> 2.5%  -4.797686 -21.7794825  2.006993
#> 97.5% 14.109621  -0.5934808 48.864636
#> 
#> Metrics:
#> $prevalence
#> [1] 0.94
#> 
#> $confusion_matrix
#>          Actual
#> Predicted  0  1
#>         0  5  1
#>         1  1 93
#> 
#> $accuracy
#> [1] 0.98
#> 
#> $sensitivity
#> [1] 0.9893617
#> 
#> $specificity
#> [1] 0.8333333
#> 
#> $false_discovery_rate
#> [1] 0.0106383
#> 
#> $diagnostic_odds_ratio
#> [1] 465
#> 
print(results$beta_hat)
#>            [,1]
#> [1,]  0.1203733
#> [2,] -1.4196705
#> [3,]  4.2684526
print(results$confidence_interval)
#>            [,1]        [,2]      [,3]
#> 2.5%  -4.797686 -21.7794825  2.006993
#> 97.5% 14.109621  -0.5934808 48.864636
print(results$metrics)
#> $prevalence
#> [1] 0.94
#> 
#> $confusion_matrix
#>          Actual
#> Predicted  0  1
#>         0  5  1
#>         1  1 93
#> 
#> $accuracy
#> [1] 0.98
#> 
#> $sensitivity
#> [1] 0.9893617
#> 
#> $specificity
#> [1] 0.8333333
#> 
#> $false_discovery_rate
#> [1] 0.0106383
#> 
#> $diagnostic_odds_ratio
#> [1] 465
#>
